bug.short_desc: Variants built but not having file name placeholders cause unpredictable output

long_desc.thetext:
If the generator finds builds its output for several values of a variant, but build-script/compile-options/paths/file does not define a filename placeholder for the variant, all the different versions are written into the same file, one over the other.
After the generator run, the file will contain the version for the last variant value which was built. Since the build order for variant values is not really defined, it is not predictable what the file will contain.
For browser variants f. i. this is not really a problem. However, it is easily possible to introduce unwanted variant builds by using the inheritance mechanism in the generator config files. I think it would be safer if the generator gives some kind of error message when it detects that it has built variants which are not expected.
